page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: {Longwood Farm }has been worked by Mr.D Stevenson for the last 10 years.He does not use chemical pesticides or fertilisers and grazes sheep and fat cattle on the steep upland pastures. The 195 acre farm has 125 acres of grassland and the rest is woodland, some so ancient that it has been there since the last Ice Age. The soil in the area is always creeping down the sides of Nottingham Hill and it has caused the demolition of at least 4 houses in the recent past. Mr. Stevenson is very interested in nature conservancy and has planted various types of native trees in spare sections of his land.In the Summer he has to seek and destroy the poisonous ragwort which may be growing in his fields.
